summary: REQ-1 and REQ-2 appear largely implemented via a new Settings/About share card, a single-source production URL config, clipboard copy with toast feedback, and QR rendering + PNG download. However, the diff introduces an external QR-code generation API dependency and backend “liveLink” state / (implied) live-link API that were not requested, and the backend method `getLiveLink()` is not evidenced in the provided backend diff excerpt.

missing_requirements.requirement: The app is deployed successfully and loads from a stable production URL.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff adds UI/config for a production URL but does not (and cannot, from code diff alone) evidence an actual successful deployment to a stable production URL.

hallucinated_features.description: Uses a third-party QR code generation web service (api.qrserver.com) to generate the QR image.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-2 only asks to render a QR code and allow downloading it; it does not request relying on an external QR API service.

hallucinated_features.description: Adds backend-side 'liveLink' state (and frontend hook logic to fetch `actor.getLiveLink()`), implying a new backend endpoint/feature for retrieving the live link.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-1 specifies the production URL should be captured in a single configurable place in the frontend; it does not request adding or depending on a backend-provided live link value.
